documents.title: victim of barnham collision named
text: a woman who died following a crash on the a134 at barnham earlier this week has been named as 47-year-old helen lovegrove , from thetford .
ms lovegrove , of magdalen street in the town , was a passenger in a skoda octavia that was in collision with a vauxhall corsa , at about 10:45 on wednesday .
a woman in her early 20s , from the dereham area , who was the driver of the corsa , remains in a serious condition at addenbrooke 's hospital after sustaining leg and internal injuries .
a man , in his 50s and from the thetford area , was driving the skoda and received treatment at the west suffolk hospital .

documents.title: overnight weather : further showers but some clear spells too
text: this evening and overnight we 'll see a mixture of showers and clear spells , with mainly light winds .
temperatures will drop to about 7c ( 45f ) .
there 'll be a chilly start to the day on saturday , with a few overnight showers lingering , but many parts will start dry with some sunshine .
more showers will eventually push in from the south-west , some of which could be heavy and thundery .
highs of about 16c ( 61f ) .
sunday should be largely dry , and feel a bit warmer .
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: protest at uea over muslim prayer space
text: a protest has been held at the university of east anglia today against the closure of a muslim prayer space .
non-muslim students linked arms nearby to show their support .
the move comes just days before ramadan , which is a month of fasting and religious focus for the muslim community .
muslim students at the uea say they were given no notice of the closure - or offered an alternative area in which to worship .
in a statement , the uea said it was in ongoing discussions with the islamic society to ensure appropriate faith provision on campus .

documents.title: davis makes weight at third attempt
text: the american boxer gervonta davis has finally made the weight for his ibf world super featherweight title fight with cromer 's liam walsh - after three attempts .
davis took to the scale in london and weighed-in two ounces above the 130 pounds ( 59 kg ) limit .
a second trip to the scales still showed him one ounce above .
the third visit was successful .
there was no such drama for walsh , who commented that it was `` unprofessional '' to not make the desired weight on the first attempt .
tension
author: Rob Butler
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: 'exhausted ' racing pigeon lands on off-shore rig
text: a racing pigeon is recovering after it landed on an off shore oil rig , before it was shipped back to shore on a supply vessel .

once the vessel had docked at the harbour yesterday morning , rspca inspector emily astillberry met with the crew of the fs kristiansand to collect the bird , before taking him up to the rspca 's wildlife hospital in east winch , norfolk .
ms astillberry said : `` this poorly pigeon has had quite the journey .
`` we suspect he had become lost and as he ventured further out to sea , became more and more exhausted .
`` the oil rig was probably a welcome pit-stop to rest up , but when the crew found him , he was in a bad way and unable to fly . ''
she said she hopes the bird will be reunited with its owner soon .
the rspca did not know the location of the oil rig .

documents.title: drug dealing 'ends lives ' , says judge
text: a judge sentencing a dealer who stabbed a man six times and left him to die has described the drugs trade as `` evil '' .
as we 've been reporting , drug-runner hassiem baqir , 20 , from thornton heath , has been jailed for life for murdering steve stannard from norwich .
mr stannard was found dead outside his bowers avenue home on 5 november .
baqir , who was found guilty yesterday , was told he must serve at least 20 years before he is considered for parole .
sentencing him today at norwich crown court , judge anthony bate said baqir had `` showed a callous indifference '' to mr stannard 's fate after he had been stabbed .
he told him : `` you left him bleeding to death on the ground and made no attempt then or later to summon help . ''
the judge said the sale of drugs was `` an evil trade that blights and ends live '' .

documents.title: family 'respects ' life sentence for murderer
text: the family of a man who was murdered have said they `` respect '' the life prison sentence handed to his drug-dealing killer .
as we 've reported , hassiem baqir , 20 , of thornton heath , was found guilty of murdering 38-year-old steve stannard , who was found dead outside his home in norwich on 5 november .
he has been told he must serve at least 20 years before he is considered for parole .

a spokesman for mr stannard 's family said : `` we respect the decision of the court and would like to request privacy at this time to continue to grieve as a family after the sad loss of our much loved stevie .
`` we will try and move on as best we can and hope that our wishes can be respected during this difficult time . ''

documents.title: drug runner jailed for life for murder
text: a drug-runner from london has been jailed for life for murder and must serve 20 years before being considered for parole .
hassiem baqir ( 20 , from thornton heath , was found guilty of murdering 38-year-old steve stannard , who was found dead outside his home in norwich on 5 november .
a post-mortem examination revealed he had been stabbed six times , norwich crown court heard .
baqir travelled from london to norwich to deal drugs from mr stannard 's flat in bowers avenue .
mr stannard was described to the court as a class a drug user with a chaotic lifestyle .
he had become involved in drug dealing from his home - a criminal act called `` cuckooing '' .
police found a knife in a bin in nearby gresham road and tests linked blood on the blade to mr stannard , and a dna profile for baqir .
det ch insp marie james said : `` we will never know the true events leading up to steve stannard 's death but this case demonstrates the dangerous consequences drug-related crime can have . ''

documents.title: police hunt for wanted man
text: police are hunting for a prisoner who is wanted in king 's lynn .
alexander hewitt , 60 , is wanted on recall to prison for breaching the terms of his licence .
he is described as white , of slim build , about 5ft 7in ( 170cm ) tall , with receding hair .
he wears glasses .
it is believed he has links in the boston and leicester areas .

documents.title: universities 'are required ' to provide prayer space
text: muslim students at the university of east anglia are calling for an alternative solution to closing their prayer facility .
as we 've reported , there are plans to withdraw space for both friday prayer and daily prayer at the campus .
the facilities are used by more than 500 muslim students at the university , plus community partners .
news of the closure comes just days before the month of ramadan - a period of fasting - gets under way .
lisa lucky , head sister at the university 's islamic society , said : `` we believe that the university will have to provide a suitable space for us and there is no way around it .
`` it 's a requirement for universities to provide for us . ''
the uea said it was having ongoing discussions with the islamic society to ensure there was appropriate faith provision on campus .
it said it was committed to ensuring there were facilities for anyone who wanted to use them .
a protest is to be held at the main square at 13:00 .

documents.title: chance to learn something new as part of national festival
text: do you want to brush up on your computer skills or fancy learning italian or sign language ?
norfolk community learning services ( ncls ) is running free taster sessions from 30 may as part of the national festival of learning .
there will be a variety of courses for people to try , whether learning to improve job prospects , increase skills or just for fun .
llgun yusuf , head of service for ncls , said : `` these taster sessions are a great way for people to try out ncls courses before they commit to something longer term .
`` we hope that the range of courses means that there 's something for everyone . ''
the free tasters will run until 3 june .

documents.title: anger over plans to close university prayer facility
text: muslim students at the university of east anglia have expressed anger over a decision to close their prayer facility .
the uea plans to withdraw space for both friday prayer and daily prayer .
the facilities are used by more than 500 muslim students at the university , plus community partners .
news of the closure comes just days before the month of ramadan - a period of fasting - gets under way .
aya delfi , from the uea 's islamic society , said : `` this is so unfair , especially as ramadan is just around the corner .
`` not only are they taking away our prayer space , they 're not giving us an alternative . ''
the university said there were ongoing discussions with the islamic society to ensure appropriate faith provision was provided on campus .

a spokeswoman said : `` we are committed to ensuring that there is no break in provision for students wishing to use our facilities , including during ramadan , during the exam period and during development works over the summer . ''
a protest will be held at the university today at 13:00 .

documents.title: election panel : your thoughts on transport
text: the bbc is running an election panel , asking voters for their thoughts ahead of 8 june .
we asked :
labour has proposed the railways should be re-nationalised .
what are your views ?
what other transport or infrastructure issues need tackling , in your view , if any ?
and you said :
amanda , peterborough : `` i do not really have an opinion on this as i never use the railways .
however , if it lowers the price for commuters and travellers then it may be a good thing . ''

marilyn samuel , luton : `` i agree to labour 's policy to propose to re-nationalise the railways and i agree to keep fares down and at a fair price , more affordable and a reliable transport system . ''
barbara , chelmsford : `` i think that railways are great as they 're now .
no changes needed . ''
jonathan , norwich : `` it would take billions to overhaul the railways , maybe the money would be better spent on trams going into major cities at affordable prices . ''
jade , southend : `` buses and trains need upgrading and a better service .
if they want less people to drive cars , public transports need a lot of improvement . ''
malcolm younger , ipswich : `` if a nationalised railway could work cheaply and efficiently i would be for it .
but do n't think that they can so should be left as they are . ''

documents.title: 'exit for brexit ' float arrives in city to greet question time audience
text: a carnival float caricature of theresa may has arrived in norwich .
the float - `` exit from brexit '' - was secured from germany by unite for europe founder peter french , and has recently been seen in and around westminster - including outside downing street .
the float is outside the forum before moving to the open at 18:00 - where audiences will be arriving for the bbc 's question time programme .
it then moves on to the paved area around st andrews hall .

documents.title: declaration of war letter comes up for sale
text: a hand-written naval officer 's letter confirming britain 's declaration of hostilities with germany in 1939 is up for auction this weekend .
written in pencil on board a ship , dated 3 september 1939 , the communication reads : `` to : all concerned , home & abroad ; from admiralty - commence hostilities at once with germany '' .
( below )
the start of the war in europe is generally acknowledged to be 1 september 1939 , when germany invaded poland .
two days later , britain and france declared war on germany .
the serving officer was william henry martin , who lived in abercynon , south wales , before moving to west hartlepool .
he survived the war .
the page , which comes from an official naval-issue message pad , was eventually given to his mother as a keepsake .
she kept it hidden in a tobacco tin , before it was passed on to the uncle of the present owner , who lives in norwich .
the document , which is expected to reach £ 200-£ 300 , is among 500 lots that will come under the hammer this saturday , as part of diss auction rooms ' militia auction .
included in the sale is a midshipman 's diary of historical interest , because it covers a first-hand account of the last shots fired in the pacific during world war two , among other events .
it was kept by john g pike , who had lied about his age in order to join the war effort aged 16 .
the journal is expected to reach £ 3000-£ 5000 .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

there are recalls for ryan finlay of horsford and vauxhall mallards bowler adam todd while swardeston batsman jason reynolds gets his first call-up .
only a win will guarantee that norfolk make the quarter finals .

documents.title: murder victim 'vulnerable member of community '
text: on 5 november last year , police officers were alerted by ambulance crews to reports of a male being stabbed in bowers avenue in the mile cross area of norwich .
steve stannard , 37 , who was found dead outside his flat , had been stabbed multiple times .
dna tests on a knife found two days later revealed blood on the blade belonged to mr stannard and to hassiem baqir , from south london .
on 15 november , baqir was charged with the murder of steve stannard .
a four-week trial at norwich crown court heard how baqir had travelled from london to norwich to deal drugs from mr stannard 's home .
steve stannard was described to the court as a class a drug user with a chaotic lifestyle , who 'd become involved in the facilitating of drugs from his address .

speaking after baqir 's conviction , det ch insp marie james said steve 's relationship with drugs made him a vulnerable member of the community , and he was easily manipulated by those wanting to transport drugs in and out of norfolk .
baqir will be sentenced at the court tomorrow .
veron antonio , of morden , was found not guilty of assisting an offender , but found guilty of being concerned in the supply of class a drugs .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: guilty verdict for norwich stabbing
text: a 20-year-old man has been found guilty of murdering a man in norwich .
steve stannard , who was 37 , died of multiple stab wounds at his flat at bowers avenue on 5 november last year .
hassiem baqir , of howberry road , thornton heath in south london , had denied his murder but had admitted dealing drugs from mr stannard 's home .
norwich crown court had earlier heard how mr stannard was stabbed twice in the back and three times in the front .
the wounds perforated his lung and his heart .
his dog , a border collie called trixy , was also stabbed .
after 15 hours deliberation , a unanimous verdict of guilty was returned by the jury .
baqir will be sentenced tomorrow .
veron antonio , of green lane , morden , south london , was found not guilty of assisting an offender .

documents.title: nine seal pups returned to the wild
text: no glasses were raised , but it was cheers all round as nine seal pups returned to the wild after being nursed back to health at the east winch wildlife centre .
the six male and three female grey seals - all named after beers - had been rescued from various sites along the east coast earlier this year .

on arrival at the rspca centre , skull splitter , jimmy riddle ( here on arrival ) , hofmeister , mad goose , pickled santa , corona , waggle dance ( further below ) , norfolk nog and skol , were given round the clock care and attention .
after hand feeding in intensive care cubicles , the pups moved into large pools where they could self feed and gain weight before reaching `` release condition '' .
last friday , the seals were released into the rive nene at sutton bridge on a receding tide .
this takes them out to the exposed sandbanks in the wash where there are other wild seals .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'no ukip means - no brexit ' warns mep
text: ukip is warning there will be no brexit if it does n't do well in the general election .
the eurosceptic party is warning voters that a conservative victory would allow theresa may to `` backslide '' on withdrawal from the eu .
they 're accusing the tories of `` remain '' candidates for key `` leave '' seats including great yarmouth , chelmsford and thurrock .

at a press conference in london , ukip mep tim aker ( said `` early warning signs '' have already surfaced that the conservatives were ready to compromise on issues such as free movement and the multi-billion pound divorce bill expected from brussels .

`` the message is clear we need a ukip voice in the commons to make sure we finish the job on brexit without ukip there would have been no referendum , without ukip in the commons , there will be no brexit '' .
mr aker is standing for the party 's top target seat of thurrock , where he finished third in a close three-way fight in 2015 - just 974 votes behind conservative jackie doyle-price .
ms doyle-price is standing again on 8 june .

documents.title: young musicians urged to 'have fun '
text: the bbc ten pieces project aims to inspire a whole new generation of youngsters to the world of classical music .
today , the bbc symphony orchestra is in acle , is running a workshop for schoolchildren from the broadland area .
spokesman shaun bajnoczky ( below , standing second from right ) had this advice for the youngsters .
`` the main thing is enjoy it if i look at an orchestra and see them smiling , i know they 're going to be playing well we 've a great day ahead of us . ''
school pupil crawford , a flautist , ( below , sitting front row , third from right ) told me he 'd quite like to join an orchestra , and the opportunity of this workshop was a great surprise .
fellow flautist rihanna ( above , front row , in blue ) agreed that it was `` amazing for them to come to our school and teach us '' .
the orchestra 's lisa nelson ( in top photo , standing on right , in pink top ) says it 's important to keep going , when given the opportunity to learn an instrument .
have fun , join in , try anything , mistakes do n't exist , learn from them i 'm from a pig farm in canada so you never know where it 's going to lead you just have fun . ''

documents.title: memorial garden vandals 'scum of the earth '
text: a father has described vandals who damaged a memorial garden for his young daughter as `` the scum of the earth '' .
seven-year-old summer grant , who was from norwich , was killed at a funfair in harlow , essex , after a bouncy castle she was playing on was swept away by high winds .
staff at valley primary academy in norwich found that the garden in summer 's memory had been damaged yesterday morning .
graffiti was also left on other parts of the school .
summer 's father lee grant said : `` i 'm thinking it 's probably some young kids who have been stupid , done what they have done .
`` i 'm hoping it was n't against summer , i do n't think it was , but even if it was n't aimed towards her , to do something like that is disgusting . ''
an inquest heard summer probably died of multiple injuries .
norfolk police has confirmed it is investigating the incident .

documents.title: chet boat to make splash at chelsea
text: for months now , a team of experts from lowestoft has had just one thing in mind - next week 's chelsea flower show .
but it 's not a garden they 've been creating , it 's a boat .
and it 's a replica of the so-called `` chet boat '' found next to the river chet on the norfolk broads four years ago .
the original is medieval and made of oak - with wooden pegs and iron nails .
the work is going on at the international boatbuilding college in oulton broad .
gary breeze is the garden 's designer and says orginally the boat would have been used for carrying reeds , eeling , sailing or punting by one person .
`` what you 'll see at the garden is this medieval chet boat surrounded by natural plants from that period which are still found on the broads and a lot of them are very rare . ''
there 's more on this story on bbc look east tonight at 18:30 .
author: Kevin Burch
BBC Look East

documents.title: what happens to mp 's who lose their seat ?
text: with at least two of the parliamentary seats in norfolk being fiercely targetted by the two main parties , the conversation in our newsroom has turned to , what happens to the present incumbent if he or she loses ?
if the polls are right ( and we know they were very wrong in the last couple of elections ) the present incumbents of north norfolk and south norwich could be looking for a new job soon .
luckily for them losing your job does n't literally mean being dumped on the street .

according to the independent parliamentary standards authority ( ipsa ) , the expenses watchdog , departing mps are entitled to a resettlement allowance , equivalent to a month 's salary for each year of service , capped at 6 months or £ 33,500 .
accommodation costs will be paid for the outgoing mp until 8 july while two months rent is paid on any constituency office .
staff are also entitled to redundancy .
the ipsa offers consultations to previous members on how they should go about winding up their office should they lose their seat .
so while they might be out of office , they should n't be out of pocket - for a few months at least .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: woman dies and two people are injured in barnham road crash
text: a woman has died and another is fighting for her life in hospital after a two-car collision in suffolk earlier .
it happened on the a134 crossroads in barnham , near thetford at about 10:45 this morning .
one woman , understood to have been a passenger in one of the cars , died at the scene .
a second woman was airlifted to addenbrooke 's hospital in cambridge with life-threatening injuries .
a third casualty , a man , is being treated at the west suffolk hospital .
both women are believed to be from norfolk .
police say the road is completely shut between ingham and barnham and is expected to remain that way for several hours .
traffic is heavy through honington as drivers attempt to avoid the road closure .

documents.title: defence secretary comes out for local candidate
text: the defence secretary sir michael fallon has been campaigning in north norfolk this afternoon .
he told supporters in holt that the seat , which is currently held by the liberal democrats , was the kind of seat which the conservatives need to win .
`` we only have a majority of twelve at the moment '' he said , `` so it 's essential that we take seats like this one and norwich south . ''
an opinion poll suggested today that both north norfolk and norwich south could go to the conservatives but he said the party was not complacent and would be `` fighting for every vote '' .
and in a dig at the labour and liberal democrat manifestos he said the election was about `` much more than legalising cannabis and extra bank holidays '' .

documents.title: 'smoke free aspiration ' for county as new tobacco rules come in
text: health officials are hoping the new rules around tobacco packaging will help in the fight to make norfolk a `` smoke free '' county .
from sunday , all tobacco products and e-cigarettes must be sold in standardized packaging (

the new boxes have had all their attractive or colourful elements removed so as to deter promotion and it will be an offence for retailers to supply any products which fail to comply with the new rules .
norfolk county council 's director of public health , dr louise smith , says together with other agencies `` the aspiration is to make norfolk smoke free . ''

`` in the most deprived areas of norfolk , smoking is still almost twice as prevalent as in the affluent areas , so there is still more work to be done and we hope that the introduction of standardised packaging will assist this . ''
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: memorial to girl killed in bouncy castle tragedy vandalised
text: a primary school teacher has said its `` disgusting '' that a memorial garden for a former pupil has been vandalised .
seven-year-old summer grant who was from norwich was killed at a funfair in harlow , essex , after a bouncy castle she was playing on was swept away by high winds .
an inquest heard summer probably died of multiple injuries .
this morning , staff at valley primary academy in norwich found that the garden in summer 's memory has been damaged , with graffiti left on other parts of the school .
norfolk police has confirmed it is investigating the incident .
stuart walker , the school 's assistant headteacher says the memorial was set up for the children to `` reflect quietly on happy memories with summer '' .
`` the garden had a cherry tree in it with a plaque saying 'summer 's garden ' .
fortunately that has not been damaged .
`` it was quite a shock and it saddened the staff when they got in .
it 's just mindless vandalism .
it 's saddened everybody . ''
a man and a woman from cambridgeshire arrested over health and safety offences in connection with the death of summer grant are due to appear in court in june .

documents.title: fluffy fenland chicks get a head start
text: conservationists bidding to save one of the uk 's `` red-listed '' endangered bird species have hatched 26 chicks .
the black-tailed godwits - which have fewer than 60 uk nests - are being hand-reared , in the joint rspb and wildfowl & wetlands trust ( wwt ) scheme .
the majority of the birds are found in the nene washes and the ouse washes on the cambridgeshire and norfolk border .
the ground-nesting birds are vulnerable to spring flooding and predators .
staff from project godwit were granted a licence from natural england to collect 32 eggs , which were incubated at wwt 's welney centre on the ouse washes in a method known as `` headstarting '' .
staff at the wwt welney centre are hand-rearing the chicks until they are old enough to be homed outside .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

text: a planning application has been submitted for nearly a thousand homes , a hotel and a school on the edge of fakenham .

that 's what trinity college cambridge , the landowner , is hoping to provide .

the firm first revealed plans in 2009 with a public consultation last year , but this is the first formal planning application for the district council to consider .

documents.title: norwich and great yarmouth markets in rent arrears
text: market traders in norwich and great yarmouth have run up thousands of pounds in rent arrears .
a freedom of information request by bbc radio norfolk has revealed the scale of the debt problem .
in 2011 the level of outstanding rent among norwich market traders stood at almost £ 29,000 - this year it 's well over £ 50,000 .
in great yarmouth it stands at £ 34,000 .
the highest individual trader debt in norwich has also risen from almost £ 5,200 to £ 10,500 in the same period .
norwich city council says a new market manager is tackling accumulated debt as well as helping stallholders who are falling behind on rent .
great yarmouth council says it 's putting in payment plans to help traders stay in business .
last night it approved a plan which promises to bring improvements to the town 's market .

documents.title: bird charity looks to extend reserve
text: the hawk and owl trust is hoping to raise £ 850,000 to extend its reserve near fakenham .
the charity wants to buy some land next to the reserve at sculthorpe moor in the wensum valley .
nigel middleton is the trust 's conservation officer .
he says the site is perfect .
`` the biodiversity here is phenomenal .
you 've got this lovely mosaic of wet woodland , fen reed bed , open pools , dykes , wate .
`` it brings a combination of lots of good things here and lots of good species as well . ''

documents.title: insurer warnings about flash flood damage
text: there 's been plenty of rain overnight in norfolk and with forecasts of more storms later , one insurance company says it 's already braced for claims .
nfu mutual says people need to be ready for possible flooding .
the company , which does a lot of business in the agricultural sector , says with dried-up land there 's more chance of flooding .

tim price , nfu rural affairs specialist , said : `` despite the massive amount of technology now used by weather forecasters , it 's still difficult to accurately predict the intensity and path of storms .
`` we 're particularly concerned because after weeks of unseasonably dry weather , land across the country remains parched which means heavy rain can run-off quickly and cause flash floods . ''

BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: grand old lady gracing the broads again
text: she graced the broads back in the 1920s , and now this 90-year-old lady is back on the waterways again .
`` spark of light '' , a wooden boat , has been brought bang up-to-date at the very boatyard where she was built for holidaymakers by herbert woods himself at the family business in 1927 .
two years later , herbert bought the business in potter heigham , forming the herbert woods company whose name is synonymous with the norfolk broads today .
michael whitaker , who 's one of the partners at the boatyard today , says the spark of light was bought by his parents in 1971 .
he was at university at the time , but had a lot of fun on it during the holidays .
mr whitaker says he is a bit sentimental about the wooden cruiser .
`` when i get on her , i close my eyes , take a deep breath , because boats have that lovely ambience and i cast myself back to quite a few years ago , '' he said .
the boat was sold to another local man in 1999 , before coming back into the fold of herbert woods in 2011 .
since then , she 's been been brought back to life , with a refurbishment that looks original , but has modern fittings .
she 's still running on her original engine .
the herbert woods boatyard at potter heigham is one of the oldest boatyards on the broads , and the spark of light is the oldest of their hire boats afloat .
the boatyard held back on making her available for holidaymakers to cruise the broads until they knew she was ready .
now the self-drive cruiser is ready for holidaymakers to explore the waterways and already bookings have been coming in .
she 's totally amazing drives an absolutely straight line .
the modern hulls are far more difficult to steer - [ but ] she 'll steer in reverse , there 's virtually no wash , she 's an eco-friendly bird . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: future-proofing facilities for prom hit by storm surge
text: new `` future-proofed '' facilities will be ready for visitors to cromer ahead of the summer season .
the catering kiosk , toilets and showers units , as well as new play equipment , are able to be craned out of the west prom area to higher ground in the event of a storm surge .
earlier this year , the town 's pier and sea front took a battering following a storm surge along the east coast .
the equipment for the themed children 's play area features a shipwreck ( and is being constructed on site this week .
weather depending , it should be ready for use within two to three weeks .
final touches are being made to the to the catering kiosk and facilities , including accessible public loos , ready for use before the start of the summer season .

documents.title: investing in seafront town 's prom
text: the new `` future-proofed '' facilities for cromer are part of £ 1m investment in the town 's west promenade to increase the visitor attractions on the whole of the promenade .

councillorr maggie prior , of north norfolk district council , says they 're committed to making the town more attractive for local people and visitors , and have a four-year programme to enhance jobs and the tourism economy .
new promenade lighting will be installed before the start of this year 's summer season , and the children 's play area will have an underwater mural illustrating the cromer chalk reef .
last year improvements were made to the zig-zag path , with refurbishment of the viewing turrets and the installation of solar lighting .
improvements costing £ 110,000 were also made to the art deco chalet block .

documents.title: tribute to man who died at skip hire site
text: an investigation is under way into the death of a man in his 20s at a business site in south norfolk .
police and health & safety executive officers are at baldwin skip hire in besthorpe , near attleborough , following the incident which happened yesterday afternoon .
managing director robert baldwin told me the man who died was a `` valued employee '' , adding their thoughts and prayers are with his family .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: historic windpump 'stands proud '
text: it will be all hands to the pump later , when the revolving cap is lifted on to the historic windpump at horsey in norfolk
a temporary lid has been in place since the cap was taken off a year ago to be rebuilt by tim whiting in saxmundham in suffolk .
two years before that , the sails came off .
it 's part of a major restoration by the national trust .
john sizer , the trust 's general manager for this area , tells me the new cap will turn to the wind .
later this summer , when the sails go back on , they will also turn - making this a fully restored working windpump .
the new cap is boat-shaped ( below ) , which is particular to the broads .
when the old one was stripped back to its original frame , wood was discovered from probably three different previous caps - some of it being up to 300 years old .
mr sizer says the project is costing about £ 305,000 - the first phase £ 245,000 and adding shutters to the sails will be another £ 60,000 .
this is an iconic building in the middle of the broads , standing proud in the landscape .
it will re-open to the public later this summer once we 've seen how well the cap settles in and is functioning properly . ''
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: raising the roof at historic windpump
text: it 's a big day for one of our historic wind pumps .
last year , the national trust began an ambitious restoration project at horsey windpump ( below ) , which will see the sails replaced and the pump put back to full working order .

in march 2016 , the cap was removed ( above ) , and shipped to millwright tim whiting 's workshop in saxmundham , suffolk where he rebuilt it , using the same tools and techniques used when the windpump was built more than 100 years ago .
later today , a 100-tonne capacity crane - .
under tim 's careful supervision - will lift the newly constructed cap and brake wheel - weighing 15 tonnes in total - into place in one go .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: willamson 's comeback surprises medical experts
text: norfolk cyclist victoria williamson says her comeback from career-threatening injuries continues to surprise medical experts .
williamson , from hevingham north of norwich , suffered a fractured neck , back and pelvis in a crash in january 2016 , but she remains part of the great britain elite squad .
the latest stage of vicky 's rehabilitation is a three-week spell at the national sports centre at bisham abbey in berkshire .
the 23-year-old told bbc radio norfolk she 's targeting a comeback at next year 's commonwealth games in australia .
at the rate i 'm going i will be race-fit by early next year .
the commonwealth games next year is looking like the first big target .
i 'm pretty confident i will be able to get back for that . ''
author: Rob Butler
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: man dies after 'catching arm in machinery '
text: police are investigating the death of a man at a business premises in south norfolk yesterday .
emergency crews , including the air ambulance , were called to baldwin skip hire in besthorpe , near attleborough , at around 13:15 .
paramedics said that staff at the site reported that the man had caught his arm in machinery .
the man , in his 20s , died at the scene .
the premises is sealed off , as detectives work with the health & safety executive to investigate what happened .

documents.title: fight for north norfolk moves up a notch
text: the conservatives ' campaign to win the seat of north norfolk in the general election moved up a step today .
justice secretary liz truss ( below ) , who 's the tory candidate for south west norfolk , was in north walsham to campaign for james wild .
despite ukip pulling out and potentially handing thousands of their votes to the conservatives , ms truss says it 's a `` straight fight '' .
`` the choice nationally is between jeremy corbyn and the havoc he 'd wreak on this country and theresa may 's stable leadership .
`` that 's what people here in north norfolk have to make up their minds about .
`` there 's no question in my mind that we have the best candidate in this race .
he 'll be a fantastic part of the norfolk team - getting a better deal for our country and as part of theresa may 's team getting a better deal for brexit . ''
the leader of the lib dems on north norfolk district council is sarah butikofer ( below ) .
she says they were expecting the tories to throw everything at north norfolk .
`` we knew this would be a target seat for the conservatives , we 've been prepared for this and we 're ready for them .
`` norman lamb 's got a huge track record , he 's worked hard for the people for 16 years , so what can they put up against that ? ''
with ukip and the greens pulling out of the fight , the third party in the race for the constituency is labour .
their candidate , stephen burke ( below ) , says the party has almost 700 members in north norfolk , more than all the other parties combined .
`` unlike the tories and the lib dems , who 're shipping in volunteers , we have a lot of members locally who can help us .

there 's a clear choice in this election and voters are more and more aware of this - labour , who 'll invest in public services like the nhs and education , and invest in people - on the other hand there 's the blue tories and the yellow tories and i think people understand what the differences are . ''

documents.title: descendant of sunken warship 's crew member meets man who 's dived onto wreck
text: a harbourmaster whose great uncle was killed when his ship was torpedoed in world war one has thanked the scuba divers who launched a search to find out more about the story behind the tragedy .

the expedition , which was led by dave lock , ( right ) , from the ipswich-based british sub aqua club idive , marked the 100th anniversary of the sinking of the light cruiser hms pathfinder off the coast of berwickshire in scotland .

robert smith , harbourmaster at wells-next-the-sea , had been researching his family history and trying to find a way of honouring his relative , when he heard about the expedition : `` robert joshua smith was the older brother of my grandfather , sidney smith .
`` he died when hms pathfinder became the first ship to be sunk by a torpedo launched from a submarine on september 5 1914 , just weeks after the outbreak of world war one . ''
dave lock said : `` we were the first group of civilian divers to receive special permission from the admiralty to raise a flag on the wreck .
`` our group included 10 experienced divers from various bsac clubs in the uk and there were some relatives of those who died with us on the boat . ''

documents.title: explosion deaths inquest to last two weeks
text: an inquest into the deaths of two men after an explosion in the north of norwich will hear from 80 witnesses and experts .
daniel timbers , 29 , and 56-year-old barry joy were working at harford attachments in spar road when they were killed in a blast on 13 july 2015 .
it was heard at norfolk coroner 's court today that the inquest , which is expected to begin on 10 july , would last around two weeks .

documents.title: hospital 'up and running '
text: the james paget university hospital is returning to normal following disruption caused by the international cyber attack which has disrupted trusts across the nhs .
graham wilde , chief operating officer at the gorleston hospital , says patient operations and clinics will be going ahead from tuesday morning .

the nhs said a very small percentage of personal computers at the hospital were infected , and these were physically isolated , with full shut-down action taken as a precautionary measure - this stopped the spread of the virus .

the a & e department is busy dealing with emergencies , so the hospital is reminding people of alternatives if their illness is n't serious , such as gp surgeries , ringing nhs 111 or contacting pharmacies .

documents.title: committee to help council 's economic growth
text: cliff jordan has been formally re-elected leader of the conservative-run norfolk county council and said earlier that `` there are people who fall through the cracks that the county needs to be there to up , and we need the money to be able to do that . ''
at today 's full council meeting it was agreed to set up a new business and property committee
this , says councillor jordan , will help the council be more business-like .
its main focus is that of generating jobs and economic growth for norfolk whilst at the same time as having a more commercial-orientated focus for the council .
we need to think about how we use property , how we generate income , in a climate where we have less and less money coming in . ''

documents.title: cyber attack 'bound to happen '
text: most surgery and outpatient appointments are going ahead as normal at the james paget after the hospital was hit by a cyber attack on friday afternoon .
it teams have been working throughout the weekend to fix problems after a `` ransomware/malicious software '' attack crippled computer systems in some health organisations in england and scotland .

david higgins , a cyber security expert based in norfolk , says the attack on britain 's health care organisations was bound to happen as people are getting far too complacent about the cyber data they hold .
people are just not taking enough care these days .
have a good think about it - did you ever order that , are you expecting an email ?
the other thing you must always do is have your anti-virus , your anti-malware system , actually up to date - get it to scan your system constantly . ''

documents.title: council leader speaks of his hopes
text: cliff jordan , who 's been re-appointed as leader of norfolk county council says he wants to be held to account better by returning to a cabinet system .
committees have made the decisions at county hall since 2014 , but mr jordan says - by law - the earliest he could switch back to a cabinet system would be 2019 .
`` the law is an ass it makes a mockery of what we want , '' he said .
`` you ca n't hold anybody to account the public have no idea .
if you say to them 'would you like to question me over this , hold me to account over that ? '
and they say 'yes , you should be ' , i say you ca n't , because that 's a committee decision . ''
mr jordan also says he wants county hall to be able to provide services to the public that require it .

not everybody wants the council sitting in and overseeing them but there are people who fall through the cracks that the county needs to be there to up , and we need the money to be able to do that . ''

documents.title: cliff jordan re-appointed as county council leader
text: conservative-run norfolk county council has met to elect its top dogs .
cliff jordan ( has been re-appointed as leader , with alison thomas as his deputy .
earlier this month , the local elections saw the conservative group take overall control at county hall , winning 55 out of 84 seats .
the party gained 114,038 votes - 48.74 % of the vote .

documents.title: ukip decision makes race 'more competitive ' says conservative candidate
text: the outcome of the general election in north norfolk is far from certain voters who were expecting five candidates to choose from have just three .
the greens have decided not to field a candidate , to help the lib dems ' norman lamb hold his seat .
meanwhile , ukip is not standing to boost the chances of conservative candidate james wild .
mr wild , a former special advisor to the defence secretary , says ukip pulling out has made the race more competitive .
i was standing on my own ticket anyway , i voted for brexit , i supported brexit and now it 's time to deliver brexit . ''

documents.title: gp surgery 'catching up ' after cyber attack
text: the knock-on effects of friday 's cyber attack are still being felt .
jane davies is a nurse practitioner at the lionwood surgery in norwich .
its computers were affected by the malware , and patients records could n't be accessed .
`` staff that were seeing people had to put things on to paper records , '' she said .
`` they then have to be put back on to the computer , so this morning we 're having to have a catch-up exercise from friday . ''
another surgery affected was the heathgate medical practice in poringland .
one patient told us she was with a gp when the receptionist came in and told the doctor to shut down all computers as they 'd been hit by a cyber attack .
the surgery tells us that is is now `` business as normal '' .

documents.title: expect rain showers this afternoon
text: outbreaks of rain will continue through the afternoon , with heavy bursts in places - although some places could stay dry .
feeling breezy , with a top temperature of 16c ( 61f ) .

documents.title: a festival of colours
text: it 's been two months since the actual date of the traditional hindu festival of holi , but one local community has made the most of the warmer weather and held their celebrations at the weekend .
the vedic cultural society of east anglia brought a splash of colour to its temple at acle on saturday , for a feast of fun , music , food - and a lot of paint .
the festival of colours has a religious signifiance to hindus , but it 's not only about good over evil .
organisers said it 's for everybody to come together , to be friends whatever background , and to share happiness .

documents.title: hospital staff 'worked together to minimise impact '
text: the deputy medical director of the james paget university hospital has praised staff after the hospital was struck by a cyber attack .
hazel stuart says staff worked together through the difficult situation over the weekend , to provide the best care they could for patients .
where possible , she says , they kept individual patients informed if they were due to come into the hospital and will continue to do so .
andrew palmer , the director in charge of the incident , says the hospital has an experienced it team which took decisive action as soon as it was aware of the cyber attack .

`` they worked into the night , and are continuing to work on restoring normal arrangements as soon as possible staff pulled together and quickly implemented paper systems to minimise the impact for patients , '' he said .
patients with appointments today and tomorrow are asked to turn up at the hospital , unless they hear otherwise .
the hospital advises that a & e is for emergencies , and if any members of the public are unwell , and it is n't serious , to phone nhs 111 or contact pharmacies .
those attending a & e with minor injuries are likely to be waiting considerably longer while the hospital uses manual systems ( ie pen and paper ) .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: canaries will need time according to former captain
text: norwich city hero grant holt is warning that fans will have to be patient following a busy summer at carrow road .
the canaries are waiting to appoint a new head coach and are expected to make several changes to their squad before the start of next season .
holt , who was named player of the year three times during his time at the club between 2009 and 2013 , has been telling me that it will be difficult for city to hit the ground running next season .
`` the championship is a tough division , everyone will strengthen , '' he said .
`` this is n't just about next season - it 's about getting everything stripped out and making sure this club is in a good state for the next five or six years . ''
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

text: patients attending the james paget university hospital in gorleston are asked to bring any medications .

text: no school today - or tomorrow - .
for pupils of redcastle family primary in thetford .

documents.title: business as usual at queen elizabeth hospital
text: while the queen elizabeth hospital in king 's lynn was unaffected by friday 's global cyber attack , it is taking a number of precautionary actions while the ongoing threat continues .
since friday evening , the hospital has been blocking all incoming external emails , and will continue to do so until further notice .
patients , carers , relatives and visitors are advised that appointments remain unaffected and that no patient confidential information has been compromised .
anyone wishing to contact the hospital is asked to do so by telephone .
medical director nick lyons says a number of patients have contacted them , concerned about their appointments .
we would like to reassure patients that it is business as usual at the qeh and would urge them to attend their appointments as normal . ''
patients urged to attend appointments as normal
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: it team 'worked flat out ' to restore hospital 's systems
text: the james paget university hospital in gorleston is one of 47 nhs organisations in england and scotland that were disrupted in the global cyber attack .
graham wilde is its chief operating officer .
he says things are now running normally , but at a slower pace .
as soon as the hospital became aware of the malware , they started to shut down computers , limiting any spread .
over the weekend , the it team went through each system , ensuring it was safe and turning it back on .
mr wild said : `` with every it system there 's a back-up in case it breaks down , any piece could fail - your home computer , your phone .
`` because of what we do , we have clear plans in place , so that we can revert to tried and tested methods like paper-base [ ie .
writing notes on paper etc ] , which is why things are a little slower , but patient confidentiality will be maintained . ''
mr wild says the hospital had to cancel `` just a handful '' of operations at the weekend , but he does n't believe the hospital was targeted deliberately .
this was a global attack there was a crack in our systems which allowed the malware to get in and once it got in , it spread .
the teams did remarkably well in containing that and rebuilt the systems over the weekend .
our staff have been working flat out , they 've gone well above and beyond , we 're really proud of them . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: witness appeal to fatal collision
text: police are appealing for witnesses to a fatal road collision on the a47 .
emergency services were called to the acle roundabout at new road at 01:30 on saturday , following the collision between a car and a flatbed recovery lorry .
the male driver of the car died at the scene .
no-one else was injured .
norfolk police are appealing for witnesses .

documents.title: cricket : norfolk suffer heavy defeat
text: norfolk crashed to their first defeat of the new minor counties cricket season after a dominant performance from lincolnshire in the knockout trophy .
the home side amassed 381 for 3 from their 50 overs .
matt lineker top-scored with 153 from only 113 balls .
in reply the visitors norfolk failed to even match lineker 's score .
they were bowled all out for 144 .
opener sam arthurton scored 56 , but only three others reached double figures .
the result means that norfolk need to win at cumberland in their final group match next sunday to progress to the quarter finals of the unicorns trophy .
norfolk outplayed to finish 144 all out and lose by a huge 237 run margin to an impressive @ twitterid # unicornstrophy

BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: hospital 'well rehearsed ' in dealing with emergencies
text: the james paget university hospital in gorleston is continuing work on its it systems after being hit by friday 's cyber attack .
pen and paper has been taking the place of the computers , and patients are being asked to fill in forms manually .

the first thing people will notice when they arrive at the hospital is that the barriers are up on the car park - there 's free parking , because the barriers are connected to the hospital 's computer system .
the hospital , which serves the great yarmouth and lowestoft area , says it is well-rehearsed in dealing with emergency situations , and they 're trying to keep disruption to a minimum .
some operations have been cancelled , but unless a patient has been told otherwise by the hospital or their gp , they should attend as usual .
i understand the norfolk & norwich university hospital and the queen elizabeth in king 's lynn , which escaped the cyber attack , are on standby .
the west suffolk in bury st edmunds was not hit , so patients in south west norfolk with appointments there wo n't be affected .
ipswich hospital is unaffected - you can follow the latest across the uk on the bbc 's cyber attack live page .
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: hospital asking patients to attend as normal following cyber attack
text: operations and clinical appointments at the james paget university hospital were cancelled over the weekend , after it was struck by the global cyber attack .
the gorleston hospital was one of 45 nhs organisations hit by the malware/ransomware attack .
over the weekend , staff had to use pen and paper after the malicious software took hold of the nhs database .
reporter andrew turner is outside the a & e department at the hospital .
he says he can see notices on the reception window telling patients they will have to fill out a registration form .
patients with booked appointments are asked to come in as usual , unless they 've been contacted and told otherwise .
the hospital advises those attending casualty with relatively minor illnesses that they are likely to be waiting considerably longer while staff are using manual systems .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rail disruption on norwich-cambridge line
text: greater anglia say trains between norwich and cambridge will not run any further than ely .
all lines are blocked , after someone was hit by a train .
passengers from norwich to cambridge can travel on norwich to liverpool street trains , and change at stowmarket or ipswich .
